archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: Letter from Mildred Tate to Mrs. Gillette inviting her to a dinner at the Hillcrest Dormitory on the campus of the Virginia Polytechnic Institute.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Mildred Tate Letter, Ms52-002, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Mildred Tate Letter was donated to Special Collections in 1952.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement and description of the Mildred Tate Letter was completed in June 2009.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Mildred Tate served as a professor of Home Economics at the Virginia Polytechnic Institute from 1937 through 1960.
The Hillcrest dormitory was the first dormitory for women built on the Virginia Tech campus.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The letter is from Mildred Tate to Mrs. Gillette inviting her to a dinner at Hillcrest, the women's dormitory at Virginia Tech, held by Mrs. White on September 11, 1940.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged by material type.
